column4: How do I know which service is using  that port?
yes but privoxy is not running!
already did that comment, it doesnt show the process!
Of course i am. And certainly, you have a running privoxy, with that PID.
I don't think that should work. invoke-rc.d privoxy stop, and if it does not work sudo pkill -9 privoxy
it did work for now:P but yeah rcconf doesn't show privoxy at startup!
sudo service privoxy stop did the trick
yeah but it seems I will have to that rc.d command
